intro: Hiraea ternifolia var. wiedeana, commonly known as the Wiedemann's three-leaved hiraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or shrubland habitats. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
